nodes.html: • Direct targets: Genes that contribute to a disease phenotype and can be directly targeted by a drug (e.g. BRAF is a direct target of vemurafenib).

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • Biomarkers: Genes whose genetic status is associated with a drug response but are not the drug target themselves (e.g. BRCA-mutated cancers responding to PARP inhibitors).

nodes.html: • Pathway members: Druggable genes found within the pathway and downstream of an altered gene (e.g. patients with mutations in TSC1/2 respond to downstream inhibition of the mTOR pathway).
